Module Placement Guidelines – INP1011/INP1015

INP1011 and INP1015 have u.fl RF connector on the module which makes it easy to plug-in an external antenna with a mating u.fl connector. Antenna placement option is indicated in the evaluation board in Figure 27. In case of u.fl, select the antenna with the specifications mentioned in the datasheet to leverage the FCC certifications.

Note: While choosing external antennas for modules 1011,1012 & 1015, take precautions to follow the antenna design guidelines provided by the antenna manufacturer while placing the antenna onto the application PCB.

Figure 27: u.fl to SMA connector for INP1011/INP1015

Thermal Ground Pad

Talaria TWO modules have thermal ground pads placed in the middle of the footprint. These modules should be grounded through four vias in each PAD. The size of each pad is 1.4mm x 1.9mm. The size of the via is 12mils. Figure 28 shows the layout and via pattern for thermal conduction.

Figure 28: Thermal ground pads
